alert.note: Alert for Camden; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank and central Currituck Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camden, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elizabeth City around 540 PM EDT. Indiantown around 550 PM EDT. Elizabeth City State University around 555 PM EDT. Whitehall Shores around 600 PM EDT. Weeksville, Shiloh and Old Trap around 615 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Bob White Fork, Belcross, Rabbit Corner, Riddle, Symonds Creek, Texas, Spences Corner, Goose Creek, Bartlett and Taylors Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
